title: Executive Order 8069-Revoking the Designation of Gateway, Montana, as a Customs Port of Entry
content: By virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by the act of August 1, 1914, 38 Stat. 609, 623 (U.S.C., title 19, sec. 2), it is ordered that the designation of Gateway, Montana, as a customs port of entry in Customs Collection District No. 33 (Montana and Idaho), be, and it is hereby, revoked.
This order shall become effective at the close of business on March 31, 1939.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8069-Revoking the Designation of Gateway, Montana, as a Customs Port of Entry Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/368665
